{% trans "The Standard Sample Types page can be accessed from the Missions Page using the Standard Sample Types button in the top right" %}

{% trans "The Standard Sample Types page allows existing sample types to be modified. A Sample type is DART's way of connecting fimular sample names like 'salts' and 'oxy' to Biochem datatypes."%}

{% trans "Sample Types come in three main levels." %}

  • {% trans "The 'Standard' sample type is the default way the biochem datatype is applied to sensors and samples when uploading data to biochem, and can be modified on the Sample Types Page*." %}
  • {% trans "A 'Mission' sample type allows the biochem datatype portion of a sample type to be applied differently for a specific mission." %} {% trans '(see Mission Samples Page)'%}
  • {% trans "'Row level' sample types allow the biochem datatype to be applied differently for specific samples within a mission" %} {% trans '(see Mission Samples Page)'%}

{% trans "*Note: " %} {% trans "modifying a 'Standard' level sample type will affect all missions where the standard level sample type has been used. Good practice would be to apply the sample type at a mission level if there is ever a chance the sample type would could be different between missions." %}

{% trans "The above image shows a 'Standard' sample type layout. Typeically sample types are created at the time they are requires on the mission samples page, but the can be created and modifeid on the Standard Sample Types Page." %}

{% trans "As noted in the above image" %}

  1. {% trans "shows the title of the sample type, this includes the short name 'acarot' and the long descriptive name 'HPLC ACAROT' both provided by the user when the sample type was created, along with the Biochem Datatype ID '90000276' and the Datatype name 'HPLC_ACAROT', this information is important for uploading samples using this sample type to Biochem" %}
  2. {% trans "shows the Biochem Datatype portion of the Sample type" %}
  3. {% trans "shows the File Configuration mappings for this sample type. " %}
    • {% trans "A file configuration describes to DART how a file should be read so when it encounters a file that has mathcing file type, header/column mappings, with the header line appearing on the defined tab." %}
    • {% trans "When a file DART has not seen before is loaded on the Mission Samples page, it is up to the user to pick the file tab, header row and select the relevant columns for the Sample ID, the Data column, a QC flag column (if it exists) and a column containing comments (if it exists)" %} {% trans '(see Mission Samples Page)'%}

{% trans "The two buttons on the Sample Type header (#1) allow the user to delete and edit the sample type. A sample type can only be deleted if it hasn't been already been to sensors and/or samples in a mission. The Sample Type can be editied, but be aware that changing the sample type on this page will change the sample type for all instances the sample type has been used as a 'Standard' sample type. For this reason it is recommended that sample types be applied at the 'Mission' level on the Mission Samples page." %} {% trans '(see Mission Samples Page)'%}
